page.title: 01ROLLING LAND EAST OF MONKTON
page.content: This area, which lies N.E. of Prestwick, is made up essentially of farmland. The land is quite evenly divided between the growing of crops, and the rearing of cattle and sheep. Roads lead only to farms, and the area is surprisingly remote considering that a main road cuts through it. This bypass, the A77, traverses existing farmland. Alongside the roads runs belts of trees. These belts consist mostly of deciduous trees, although some pines can also be seen. HMS Gannet stands on the end of Prestwick Airport, a number of helicopters and their hangers lining the end of the runway. HMS Gannet is a Royal Navy, Anti-Submarine establishment. British Aerospace, manufacturers of small aircraft, are also a prominent feature. The Dutch House caravan park is a common landmark for travellers on
